content.question: A student makes the claim that when one end of an uncharged iron rod is brought near a charged glass sphere, one end of the rod becomes positively charged and the other end becomes negatively charged, resulting in a net charge on the rod. Which of the following provides evidence that the rod still does not have a net charge?

choices.label: The ends of the rod will attract or repel a small metal sphere.
The ends of the rod will attract or repel small pieces of paper.
When the rod is grounded, the sphere is removed, and then the ground is removed, the rod attracts or repels other charged objects.
When the sphere is removed and the iron rod is momentarily touched to another metal object, the rod and the object do not repel each other.

content.answer: When the sphere is removed and the iron rod is momentarily touched to another metal object, the rod and the object do not repel each other.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
